meanings.definition: The act of going out or exiting.
meanings.sent1: The egression of the students from the school was orderly and quick.
meanings.sent2: The egression of the birds from their nests signaled the start of spring.
meanings.sent3: The egression of the clown from the tiny car was a hilarious sight.
meanings.sent4: The egression of the sun from behind the clouds bathed the landscape in golden light.
meanings.sent5: The egression of the water from the dam created a powerful rush downstream.

meanings.definition: The process of emerging or coming forth.
meanings.sent1: The egression of new ideas in the meeting was refreshing.
meanings.sent2: The egression of the butterfly from its chrysalis was a beautiful sight.
meanings.sent3: The egression of the cake from the oven filled the kitchen with a delicious aroma.
meanings.sent4: The egression of the truth from the witness shocked everyone in the courtroom.
meanings.sent5: The egression of the stars in the night sky was a breathtaking sight.

meanings.definition: The act of leaving or departing.
meanings.sent1: The egression of the train from the station marked the beginning of the journey.
meanings.sent2: The egression of the guests from the party signaled its end.
meanings.sent3: The egression of the cat from the room left behind a trail of fur.
meanings.sent4: The egression of the old year and the arrival of the new brought hope for better days.
meanings.sent5: The egression of the soldier from the battlefield was a moment of relief for his family.
